title: Rear Suspension Unit - Disassembly

body.body: Wear eye and hand protection when you release or compress the spring on the rear suspension unit. The spring on the rear suspension unit is under pressure and if released suddenly can cause injury.
With the aid of an assistant, compress the spring by hand until the spring seat is accessible.
Remove the spring seat from the groove of the lower mount.
Slowly release the tension from the spring and let the spring pass over the lower mount of the rear suspension unit.
Fully clean all dirt and contamination from all components.
Examine all components for wear or damage. Replace all worn or damaged components.

Always renew both rear suspension units as a pair, even if only one appears to be faulty. If only one suspension unit is replaced, the handling of the motorcycle could be adversely affected. This could result in an unsafe riding condition leading to a loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Examine the damper assembly for fluid leaks and replace the assembly if there are leaks.
